content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Sure! Here is a simple function written in Julia that does exactly what you asked. It filters out any word from an input list of strings `words` which don't begin with an uppercase character:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    # Initialize an empty array to store the results
    result = []
    
    for word in words
        # Check if first character is uppercase
        if isuppercase(word[1])
            # If it is, add this word to our result
            push!(result, word)
        end
    end
    
    return result
end
```
This function works by iterating over each word in the input list. For each word, it checks if the first character (at index 1 because indexing starts at 1 in Julia) is uppercase using the built-in `isuppercase` function. If the character is uppercase, it adds the word to the result array. At the end of the function, the result array is returned.
